comment: I took her for persuausion methods online. The class was extremely easy. The final is tedious and alot of writing but everything else was really easy. Only one assignment a week and it's a discussion board.

Let this class be your last option. There are weekly LinkedIn posts and they take up a lot of time, and she's a tough grader. I tried my best on every post and I received bad grades. I don't even feel smart anymore because my work obviously wasn't enough for her. The final project was a social media proposal and that was 22 pages. Hope this helps:)

Discussion every week, two exams, two midterm-like assignments, and a final project. Very picky in grading, will ask for more detail and then be given more detail and still unsatisfied. Says things like "good start but lost your way." A little condescending. Don't take this class unless you can buy the textbook.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: I took professor Weed for PR 4210 - Social Media for Strategic Com and have also taken her for Visual Com. She is a good professor, she cares about her subject, and wants you to succeed. I will say that her classes are packed full of work, but they are assignments that will actually benefit you, teach you things, and possibly help with future jobs.

Professor Weed was a good professor! I took the class online so I did not interact with her much but the class (Visual Comm) was not super hard. The modules had lots of info, but there were not many assignments. I would say my least favorite part was the final project. Overall though, the class was not hard. Clear instructions and fair grader.

She was a good professor. She provided great feedback on my assignments, and it helped me do better with future projects. I took this class during the summer, so it was a quick course. The textbook was mandatory, and the reading does help on the quiz.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: I heard that this class is easier on campus during the school year with a diff prof rather than over the summer Dr Weed is a harsh grader but the class is manageable The only downside is you have to purchase the $55 textbook which is useful for the tests and projects 2 exams 3 projects and 8 discussion posts I wouldve rather taken thisclassinperson

rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: The professor is nice, and make sure to attend her classes even though participation doesn't matter because she does give out bonus points for those who come. There are 3 big projects (the last project counts as the final), 13 discussion posts, and 3 tests. There is no midterm or final exam in this course. I recommend taking her, you learn a lot!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Gives good feedback

comment: Loved Professor Weed's class. I definitely recommend taking her and I will for sure be taking her again in the future. She makes the class so interesting and her weekly modules are great. Her discussion post get you thinking and have great conversation starters with classmates.

She is a nice woman, but she is wayyyy too harsh of a grader. Her lectures are extremely boring and proved to be a total waste of time during an already jam packed semester. I would not recommend her.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Inconsistent with grading. Doesn't give good feedback. Lots of things she makes you do end up being a complete waste of time.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: It is a really interesting class, and you will learn a lot. Dr. Weed does not respond to emails, and she never updated the grading portion in the syllabus. She does not send out any announcements. Required work: 10 discussion posts, 3 blogs, 2 projects, a paper and social media marketing certification course. Cool class if you're willing to work
